headline: Sri Lankan President Ends Search for Missing From Civil War
abstract: A decade after the close of a bloody civil war, 24,000 remain missing. A new president acknowledged that many of them were in fact dead.
lead_paragraph: Dashing the hopes of thousands of families desperate for word about loved ones who went missing during Sri Lanka’s long, grisly civil war, the country’s new president has offered an unsparing rebuff to their quest for closure.
keywords: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
